We have now consulted the local authority associations.The County Councils Association and the Convention of Royal Burghs(Scotland) have agreed to our proposal,but the Association of municipal corporations and the Scottish County Councils Association are not willingto agree; the Scottish Counties of Cities Association have not yet made their views known. We have no doubt that notwithstanding the objectionsof two of the associations it would now be impossible for the Governmentto do other than implement the award. We accordingly seek authorityto include an appropriate enabling provision in the Bill, for whoseintroduction as early as possible in the next Session authority has alreadybeen given, and to inform the associations that, after taking full accountof their views, the Government have thought it right to adopt this course.G, LL, *-G.J. S.Whitehall, S.W.1.14th September, 1956.
